info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN GUERNSEY...MUSKINGUM AND CENTRAL NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 621 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Somerset to near Byesville. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, Cambridge, Caldwell, New Concord, South Zanesville, North Zanesville, Philo, Pleasant Grove, Pleasant City, Cumberland, Summerfield, and Belle Valley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio near mile marker 143, and between mile markers 145 and 177. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 26 and 39, and between mile markers 48 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio.
